pageContext.claim: “India has six seven eight percent [GDP growth], when China used to have 11, 12 percent they're still at six or seven, when they're at seven percent they're feeling badly and I'd say how come we have to be at one percent. Well, it's the size, I said really well, China is bigger than we are, and India has 1.5 billion people.”
pageContext.analysis: China is coming off of the biggest economic boom the world has ever seen. But the difference in growth rates has to do with that different stages of development have different growth rates. And many less wealthy countries have been developing at rapid rates to catch up to wealthier ones.
